description.narrative:
NGO HUB387 har ansökt om finansiering på 18,3 miljoner kronor för att genomföra programaktiviteter i Bosnien och Hercegovina under perioden 2014-2017.
Interventionen har två huvudkomponenter; upprättandet av Academy 387 och ett så kallat startup-program. För Academy 387 är målet, i första hand, att skapa en plattform med ett brett utbud av utbildningsprogram. Syftet är att skapa och genomföra intensiva, tidsbegränsade kurser och praktiska seminarier i syfte att överbrygga klyftan mellan de kvalifikationer som begärs av dagens specialiserade IT-företag och de kvalifikationer som den lokala arbetskraften besitter. Startup-programmet kommer att utföras under 18 månader, med sex på varandra följande faser av inkubationscykler. Det huvudsakliga målet i slutet av programmet är att skapa totalt åtta hållbara IT- företag med stor potential för skapandet av nya arbetstillfällen. De två delkomponenterna kommer båda att generera tillväxt, en rad nya arbetstillfällen och främja entreprenörsandan genom att uppmuntrar unga och ambitiösa människor att ta en mer aktiv roll i att skapa försörjningsmöjligheter i framtiden.
NGO HUB387 kommer att genomföra samtliga aktiviteter i nära samarbetat med andra investerare inom den privata sektorn. Interventionens totala budget är över 45 miljoner kronor, varav den privata sektorns finansiering är cirka 27 miljoner kronor och resterande 18,3 miljoner kronor är Sidas bidrag.

NGO HUB387 has requested funding of 18.3 million for the implementation of program activities in Bosnia and Herzegovina during the period 2014-2017.
The intervention has two main components; establishing Academy 387 and a so-called startup programme. The aim for Academy 387 is, to firstly, create a platform with a wide range of educational programs. Academy 387 will create and implement intensive, time-limited courses and practical workshops in order to bridge the gap between the skills required by today's specialized IT companies and the skills of local workforce. The startup program will span over 18 months, with six successive phases of incubation. The main goal at the end of the program is to have created a total of eight sustainable IT company with great potential for job creation. Both of the two components, will generate growth, a number of new jobs and strengthen the entrepreneurial spirit by encouraging young and ambitious people to participate in creating opportunities for the future.
NGO HUB387 will implement all activities in close co-operated with other investors in the private sector. The intervention’s total budget is over 45 million SEK, out of which private sector funding is around 27 million SEK and the remaining SEK 18.3 million is Sida's contribution.

The main objective of the proposed intervention is the creation of new job opportunities along with the establishment of an educational academy promoting a skillset diversification that has been demanded by the labor market. The intervention is a response to the current economic situation in Bosnia and Herzegovina, with high unemployment rates among the young population, and with a negative trend of brain drain of the skilled work force (particularly noticeably in the IT segment). The intervention also aims at stimulating the currently virtually nonexistent local IT ecosystem.

description.narrative: HUB 387 did not prove as efficient as expected in terms of start-ups. The initial plan was for 8 start-ups to be up and running at the end of the project. However, at the end of the project only 3 companies are still active, with only two of them being registered and full start-ups. The third is still in it's incubator phase. Compared to other similar start-up incubators in the country, HUB 387 was quite inefficient in relation to the amounts of funds available. The project only held one hackaton competition to select ideas for start-ups which resulted in 7 ideas being selected. However, for different reasons, 4 of those 7 did not survive and the project did not have another competition, despite it being initially planned. Instead all of the resources were put into this small number of start-ups to help them grow. The project ended up fully subsidizing the start-ups which was not initially planned. The future sustainability and ability to make profits when external funding is gone is yet uncertain. In contrast, the Academy387 was quite efficient in the delivery of courses and managed to reach more students than initially planned. How efficient it was in creating new job opportunities is however uncertain because of data deficiencies. Data available from the first year of operations suggest that about a fifth of students found a new or a better job after attending the academy while 60 % of students were already employed when attending. No data is available for the remaining years.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
